books.title: Phoebe, Junior
books.author: Margaret Oliphant
books.summary: The friendship between the daughters of a dissenting minister and an Anglican clergyman tests boundaries of class and wealth.

books.title: Kidnapped
books.author: Robert Louis Stevenson
books.summary: After his parents die, a young Scottish man travels to see his only remaining relative, expecting to be welcomed, but instead finds his life and liberty in grave danger.

books.title: A Daughter of the Samurai
books.author: Etsu Inagaki Sugimoto
books.summary: The autobiography of Etsu Sugimoto, a girl born into a samurai family in a time of great cultural changes.

books.title: Queen Victoria
books.author: Lytton Strachey
books.summary: A sardonic and generally unflattering biography of Victoria Alexandrina, Queen of England.

books.title: Cornelli
books.author: Johanna Spyri
books.summary: A young girl’s emotional hurt requires time and love to heal.

books.title: Psmith, Journalist
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: Psmith, visiting New York with Mike on a cricket tour, finds entertainment and trouble for himself in the newspaper business, stirring up trouble with New York’s notorious gangs.

books.title: The Taming of the Shrew
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: An unmarriageable shrew receives a marriage proposal.

books.title: Harding’s Luck
books.author: E. Nesbit
books.summary: A poor orphan boy accidentally discovers magic which sends him into the past and leads to his recovery of a fortune and a lordly title.

books.title: Midwinter
books.author: John Buchan
books.summary: Treachery threatens a planned Jacobite uprising, but one of its leading agents can’t work out the identity of the culprit.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: M. R. James
books.summary: A collection of ghost stories written by M. R. James.

books.title: Red Dusk and the Morrow
books.author: Paul Dukes
books.summary: A newly-minted secret agent is sent to pick up the pieces of Britain’s spy networks after they are shattered by the Red Terror.

books.title: The Return of Sherlock Holmes
books.author: Arthur Conan Doyle
books.summary: The world’s first consulting detective returns to London after having faked his death some years before, and investigates a series of baffling mysteries.

books.title: What’s Wrong with the World
books.author: G. K. Chesterton
books.summary: Philosopher G. K. Chesterton comments on various social issues of his day, including property, imperialism, feminism, and education.

books.title: Darkwater
books.author: W. E. B. Du Bois
books.summary: A collection of essays, short fiction, and poetry related to the lives of black people in Jim Crow-era America.

books.title: Poetry
books.author: Georgia Douglas Johnson
books.summary: A collection of poems by Georgia Douglas Johnson.

books.title: Evelina
books.author: Fanny Burney
books.summary: A young woman navigates the absurdities of 18th-century English society, fends off various suitors, and attempts to establish her true parentage.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Frank Belknap Long
books.summary: A collection of short fiction by Frank Belknap Long, ordered by date of original publication.

books.title: The Secret of Father Brown
books.author: G. K. Chesterton
books.summary: The fourth set of stories of a Catholic priest who is also an amateur detective.

books.title: The Pilgrim Kamanita
books.author: Karl Gjellerup
books.summary: An Indian merchant’s son sets on a pilgrimage after a life of love, loss, business, and pleasure, and unknowingly relates his tale to the Buddha.

books.title: Three Men in a Boat
books.author: Jerome K. Jerome
books.summary: The humorous travelogue of a boating holiday down the Thames taken by three friends and their dog.
